content.description: Climb on to the short slab to the vertical finger crack, and then continue straight up following the crack.
content.protection:
There a few placements for small stoppers. I was not able to find any solid cam placements, but you might have luck if you bring some microcams. Protection gets sparse towards the top, so I had to run it out a bit. I would not recommend this for beginning leaders.

 For a toprope anchor, there might be some options for a gear based anchor. If you have long slings, there are also some trees further back.
content.location:
Look for the obvious vertical finger crack on Crag 4. There is also a small boulder on the ground at the start.

 Descent: you can walk off to climber's right.

content.description:
This is the tallest of the rocks here at 35 feet. It faces east. Anchors are fairly far back from the edge of the cliff. Bring long slings.

 L->R: A. The Notch, 4. B. Duster, 4 PG-13, 1p, 35', gear or TR. C. Bomber, 5. D. Broken Blocks, 2.
